title: How to graph to determine index of refraction

content.question:
<math alttext="theta sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> (degrees)

<math alttext="theta sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> (degrees)

<math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="10.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="20.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="48" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>48</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="30.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="64" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="37.9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37.9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="39.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>39.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

A student measures the incident angle <math alttext="theta sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the refracted angle <math alttext="theta sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of a beam of light that travels through air and then enters a material of unknown index of refraction. The student’s data for several angles are shown in the table above. Which of the following procedures should the student follow so that the slope of a best-fit line will be the index of refraction of the material?

choices.label: Graph <math alttext="theta sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="theta sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Graph <math alttext="theta sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="theta sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Graph <math alttext="the sine of theta sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="the sine of theta sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>sin</mi><msub><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Graph <math alttext="the sine of theta sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mtext> </mtext><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="the sine of theta sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Graph <math alttext="the sine of theta sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mtext> </mtext><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="the sine of theta sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
